p: Another impact the COVID-19 pandemic may have is on the nature and content of the psychotic pathology of people with psychosis or at risk of psychosis. Clinicians working in mental health services have given anecdotal reports of increased paranoia [content] around contamination from being in close contact with other people. The association between psychosis and a range of psychosocial factors, including stressful life events, has been extensively explored, suggesting it is an important risk factor for both the onset and exacerbation of symptoms ( Fusar-Poli et al., 2017).
